item.description:
A Day at the Museum - Hillstead

It has been quite some time since we have been to this museum, It will be First Sunday and we will join in on Gallery talk at 1:00, come join us, At 2:00 there are grounds tours.  Wear comfortable shoes and warm clothes as we will also be wondering the grounds to check out the special exhibit of Lyman Whitakers Wind Sculptures.

Admission:$12 adults, $10 seniors (62+), $8 students, $5 children ages 6-12,
free to members and children under age six.

Renowned French Impressionist paintings—four by Claude Monet, three by Edgar Degas— and notable works by Édouard Manet, Mary Cassatt and James McNeill Whistler are highlights of the in situ exhibition. The collection also includes 250 prints and photographs, 290 ceramics, 400 pieces of furniture, a 3,300-volume library and 16,000-plus archival documents. The 152-acre property features an Arts and Crafts carriage barn and theater, stone garages, woodland trails, a pond and dairy complex, and a Sunken Garden designed by Beatrix Farrand c. 1920.

Hill-Stead is a National Historic Landmark and an Official Project of Save America’s Treasures. In 2003, the American Association of Museums awarded Hill-Stead accreditation. Hill-Stead is a member of the Connecticut Art Trail, the Connecticut Women’s Heritage Trail and Connecticut’s Historic Gardens.

Through Spring 2012
LYMAN WHITAKER WIND SCULPTURES
Hill-Stead's Kitchen Garden, overlooking the estate's meadows and woodland trails, provides an ideal backdrop for this installation of twelve peaceful, undulating wind sculptures by renowned kinetic artist Lyman Whitaker. The sculptures, ranging in height from 5 to 28 feet, are handmade of copper and stainless steel and interact with even the slightest breeze. The sculptures are exhibited courtesy of Leopold Gallery, Kansas City, and will remain on view through 2011.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in the entry where tickets are purchased. Will wear the bw scarf with piano keys.
item.name: A Day at the Museum
